page.title: 10FARMING AND WILDLIFE, WARE
page.content: In 1984 farmer Geoff Vigus,chairman of the{Farming and Wildlife Organisation, put one of his ideas into action. When faced with a damp hollow in a restored gravel pit, the quarry wanted to drain it but instead he made the area into a {large pond.}Stocking it with fish to make money from anglers, would have discouraged natural plants and animals so now it is left for wildlife. Many{new trees}have been planted to replace those removed by the quarry. Some trees will provide a wind-break and hide ugly buildings. Small copses will encourage animals and avenues of trees will screen the gravel pits. In the future Mr.Vigus envisages an {amenity farm}for people to see farming demonstrations and enjoy the country- side and wildlife.He has put his plans to the owners but doubts whether they will be achieved in his lifetime.
